posts.title: Hello, World!
posts.text: Printing hello world in different languages C :12345#include<stdio.h>int main(){ printf("%s\n","Hello, World!"); return 0;} C++ :123456#include<iostream>using namespace std;int main(){ cout<<"Hello, World!\n"; return 0;} java :12345public class hello{ public static void main(String[] args){ System.out.println("Hello, World!"); }} python :1print("Hello, World!") C# :123456using System;class first{ static void Main(){ Console.WriteLine("Hello World"); }} GO:12345package mainimport "fmt"func main(){ fmt.Println("Hello, WOrld!")}

posts.title: Installing language compilers on Linux
posts.text: Programs witten in any programming language can be run in Linux easily from terminal. All you need is a terminal and a compiler to compile the programme file. How to compile and run c/c++ program in Linux C/C++Compile C language:Compiler : GCC developed by GNU ProjectInstallation: Ubuntu or any Debian System 12sudo apt get updatesudo apt install gcc Arch Linux 12sudo pacman -Sysudo pacman -S gcc Fedora 12sudo yum updatesudo yum install gcc
